item.content:encoded:
Gatsby Troubleshooting

As the final topic of [Creating a Gatby Blog], we discuss some issues and solutions that arise while using Gatsby.

Excerpt output not working properly

The first problem I encountered while using Gatsby is that Excerpt cannot be printed well if it is not in English (latine language), as follows. If Excerpt does not work properly, there may be a problem in outputting postings as shown below, and there may be cases where the search engine does not search properly. In fact, search engine optimization guides sometimes warn that the description is insufficient.

Excerpt is a text summary used by Gatsby, and it is indicated in the description of the meta tag.

NO Excerpt (before) Target Outcome (after)

The figure above is ...a case in which the summary content is marked only with , in the post on my blog . This problem has been going on for a very long time, and it occurs in the case of languages ​​other than Latin languages ​​such as English.

The webmaster tool and optimization tool of the search engine also output the following warning message. This is a warning that the description of the meta tag is too short. The following 6 cases are cases where the Description is ...only registered as .

The following is the result of directly querying Graphql. Similarly, you can see that the result of the excerpt item is returned as "...".

Solution

In fact, this issue has been known for a very long time. It's a non-Latin language support issue with Gatsby's "markdownRemark". It is also provided as official troubleshooting in Gatsby Plugin, and it can be solved by adding the following option to the excerpt item when querying in graphql.

excerpt(truncate: true)

In the actual official guide, it is introduced as follows.

Excerpts for non-latin languages
By default, excerpt uses underscore.string/prune which doesn’t handle non-latin characters (https://github.com/epeli/underscore.string/issues/418).
If that is the case, you can set truncate option on excerpt field, like:
{
  markdownRemark {
    excerpt(truncate: true)
  }
}

In my blog, you can check that the query is normally output by changing the query in the GraphQL editor.

query {
    allMarkdownRemark(filter: {frontmatter: {title: {ne: ""}}}, sort: { fields: [frontmatter___date], order: DESC }, limit: 100) {
      edges {
        node {
          excerpt(format: PLAIN, truncate: true)
          fields {
            slug
          }
          frontmatter {
            date(formatString: "MMM DD, YYYY")
            update(formatString: "MMM DD, YYYY")
            title
            category
            tags
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }

EDIT: on line 6 excerpt(format: PLAIN, truncate: true)

As a result, Excerpt is normally output as follows, and the summary and description of the posting can be entered normally.

item.content:encoded:
Gatsby 트러블슈팅

[Gatby Blog 만들기]의 마지막 주제로, Gatsby를 사용하면서 발생하는 몇몇 이슈와 해결 방법에 대해여 논의해 본다.

Excerpt 출력이 잘 안되는 문제

Gatsby를 사용하면서 가장 처음 직면한 문제는 다음과 같이, 영어(latine Language)가 아니면 Excerpt를 잘 출력하지 못하는 이슈이다. Excerpt가 제대로 동작하지 않는 경우, 다음과 같이 포스팅글을 출력하는데에도 문제가 있을 뿐만 아니라, 검색엔진이 제대로 검색을 못해주는 경우가 발생할 수 있다. 실제로, 검색엔진의 최적화 가이드에서 Description이 부족하다는 경고를 하기도 한다.

Excerpt는 Gatsby가 사용하는 본문 요약으로써, meta tag의 description에 표기한다.

NO Excerpt (포스팅글의 요약이 빠져있다.) 목표로 하는 결과물

위 그림은 실제 필자의 블로그에서 포스팅글에 요약내용이 ... 으로만 표기되어 있는 경우이다. 이 문제는 매우 오랫동안 진행되어온 이슈로 영어 등의 Latin Language 계열이 아닌 다른 언어의 경우에 발생하는 문제이다.

검색엔진의 웹마스터 도구 및 최적적화 도구에서도 다음과 같은 경고 문구를 출력하고 있다. Meta tag의 Description이 너무 짧다는 경고 이다. 아래 6건은 Description이 ... 으로만 등록되어 있는 경우이다.

다음은 Graphql을 직접 질의했을 때의 결과이다. 마찬가지로, excerpt 항목의 결과가 "..."으로 반환 되는 것을 확인 할 수 있다.

해결 방안

사실, 이 이슈는 매우 오랫동안 알려져 있는 문제이다. Gatsby의 "markdownRemark"의 non-Latin Language support 문제이다. Gatsby Plugin에서도 공식 Trubleshooting으로 제공하는 제용으로써, graphql에서 질의할 때, excerpt항목에 아래와 같은 옵션을 추가함으로써 해결할 수 있다. 

excerpt(truncate: true)

실제 공식 가이드에는 다음과 같이 소개되고 있다. 

Excerpts for non-latin languages
By default, excerpt uses underscore.string/prune which doesn’t handle non-latin characters (https://github.com/epeli/underscore.string/issues/418).
If that is the case, you can set truncate option on excerpt field, like:
{
  markdownRemark {
    excerpt(truncate: true)
  }
}

필자의 블로그에서 GraphQL 에디터에 질의문을 변경하여 정상 출력 되는 것을 확인 할 수 있다. 

query {
    allMarkdownRemark(filter: {frontmatter: {title: {ne: ""}}}, sort: { fields: [frontmatter___date], order: DESC }, limit: 100) {
      edges {
        node {
          excerpt(format: PLAIN, truncate: true)
          fields {
            slug
          }
          frontmatter {
            date(formatString: "MMM DD, YYYY")
            update(formatString: "MMM DD, YYYY")
            title
            category
            tags
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }

수정사항 : 6번 라인에서 excerpt(format: PLAIN, truncate: true)

결과적으로 다음과 같이 Excerpt가 정상 출력되고, 이 에 따라 포스팅글의 요약문과 Description을 정상입력할 수 있다.

TTS (Text to Speech)

Google TTS

구글 TTS 설치

$ pip install gTTS

Quick start

$ gtts-cli 'hello' --output hello.mp3

python code

from gtts import gTTS
tts = gTTS('hello. this is the first application')
tts.save('hello.mp3')

오디오/mp3 재생 (Multimedia play)

Mpg321

python의 기본 모듈 (pyaudio 등)에는 mp3 코덱이 포함되어 있지 않다. 아마도 mp3 라이선스 문제일 것으로 예상된다. 따라서, mp3 와 같은 오디오 재생은 별도의 모듈의 설치가 필요하다. 필자가 사용한 오디오 모듈 중 안정성과 편의성을 고려하여 가장 쉬운 모듈은 mpyg321이었다.

mpg321은 가장 단순하면서도 인기가 높은 커맨드라인 (command-line) mp3 플레이어(player) 이다. 명령어줄(command line)에서 mpg321 파일명.mp3 입력만으로 mp3를 재생할 수 있다.

GNU License v.2 (Gerneal Public License v.2)

mpyg321은 공용 라이브러리인 mpg321을 python으로 감싸놓은 모듈이다. 따라서, mpg321모듈을 먼저 설치하고, mpyg321을 설치한다.

MacOS

$ brew install mpg321
$ pip install mpyg321

Linux

$ sudo apt-get install mpg321
$ pip3 install mpyg321

Windows

$ pip install mpyg321

명령어 라인 사용법

$ mpg321 <mp3파일명>
    or 
$ mpg321 -q <mp3파일명>

-q 옵션은 quite mode 이다.

파이썬(Python) 코드 사용법

from mpyg321.mpyg321 import MPyg321Player()
player = MPyg321Player()
player.play_song("/path/to/some_mp3.mp3")

참조 : https://pypi.org/project/mpyg321/

또 다른 형태로는, 커멘드라인 구문을 바로 실행 시키는 방법이 있다. 

import subprocess
subprocess.Popen(['mpg321', '-q', path]).wait()

좀 더 단순한 방법으로는 다음과 같은 구문이라 하겠다. 

import os
os.system('mpg321 -q '+ path)
	    or 
r = os.popen('mpg321 -q '+ path)

pygame

2번째 방법은 pygame 모듈을 사용하는 방법이다. 

$ pip install pygame
from pygame import mixer

mixer.music.load('hello.mp3')
mixer.music.play()

item.title: How to decorate images and backgrounds in your blog (ft. Parallax)
item.description: There are two ways to apply HTML/CSS in this process. How to apply it to Gatsby Source and React Component How to apply style to markdown d…
item.content:encoded:
The content to be discussed in this post is about the various additional decorative effects in the images of the Gatsby Blog that I have made so far. Representative background image processing and side menus are mentioned. CSS will be used in this process. We are not going to cover CSS from scratch, but we will look at excerpts from frequently/usable parts.

There are two ways to apply HTML/CSS in this process.

  1. How to apply it to Gatsby Source and React Component
  2. How to apply style to markdown document

The first method is the general method for applying CSS. You'll probably want to use this method when you're constantly applying styles to the page. The second method is for temporary use only in limited postings. In my case, I used the second method to show an example limited to this post.

There are several ways to apply html/css in Markdown, but in remark, a Gatsby Plugin, you can use it like a normal tag. However, note that the styletag can be used only once. If you use the style tag in multiple places, it doesn't work.

1. Decorate the background image.

What we are going to do in this post is to add various additional effects to the images of the Gatsby Blog that we have created so far. In particular, let's apply "Parallax Background" applied to my upper title image.

The following is the result of comparing the normal background image and the Parallax background image. Parallax was applied to the left image, and a normal background image was used for the right image. When moving the scroll, the image does not move along the scroll, but the image window that is displayed appears to move.

Parallax Non Parallax

Parallax: The background image itself is fixed, and the visible frame window moves according to the scroll.

This effect can be implemented by applying the following CSSf. The important elements are the background-imageand background-attachmentitems. By specifying the background-attachment item as fixed, it is the result of fixing the image regardless of scrolling. The rest is about the size and the size/repetition of the displayed image.

*In the example below, a random image url of unsplash was used rather than a fixed image.

<style>
.parallax {
  background-image: url("https://source.unsplash.com/random");
  min-height: 500px; 
  width: 500px;
  height: 500px;
  background-attachment: fixed;
  background-position: center;
  background-repeat: no-repeat;
  background-size: cover;
}
</style>

참조 : https://www.w3schools.com/

2 Let's make Animation Menu

You can create a scroll-independent side menu (Fixed) on the following pages. The image below is the result. In addition, this menu has been applied only to the current posting.

Animation Menu item 1 Animation Menu item 2
About Blog Projects Contact

The CSS and HTML used are as follows.

#Sidenav a {
  position: fixed;
  left: -90px;
  transition: 0.3s;
  padding: 15px;
  width: 100px;
  text-decoration: none;
  font-size: 20px;
  color: white;
  border-radius: 0 5px 5px 0;
}
#Sidenav a:hover {
  left: 0;
}
#about {
  top: 20px;
  background-color: #04AA6D;
}
#blog {
  top: 80px;
  background-color: #2196F3;
}
#projects {
  top: 140px;
  background-color: #f44336;
}
#contact {
  top: 200px;
  background-color: #555
}

In the CSS above, positionthe position where the menu is displayed varies depending on the property value. If you want the menu to be displayed at the top of the page, it is absoluterecommended. I fixedapplied because I wanted the menu to keep its position and follow it even when I scroll down .

<div id="Sidenav" >
	<a href="#" id="about">About</a>
	<a href="#" id="blog">Blog</a>
	<a href="#" id="projects">Projects</a>
	<a href="#" id="contact">Contact</a>
</div>

item.title: 배경 이미지 꾸미기 (ft. Parallax)
item.description: 이 과정에서 HTML/CSS를 적용할 때 2가지 방안이 있다. Gatsby Source 및 React Component에 적용하는 방법 markdown 문서에 Style 적용하는 방법 첫번째 방법이 CSS적용에 일반적인 방법이다. 지속적으로 페이지…
item.content:encoded:
이번 포스팅에서 거론할 내용은, 이제 까지 만들어본 Gatsby Blog의 이미지에서 여러 가지 부가적인 꾸밈효과에 관한 내용이다. 대표적으로 배경이미지 처리와 사이드 메뉴를 거론한다. 이 과정에서 CSS가 사용될 것이다. CSS를 처음부터 다루지는 않고 자주/유용하게 사용할 만한 부분을 발췌하여 살펴볼 예정이다.

이 과정에서 HTML/CSS를 적용할 때 2가지 방안이 있다.

  1. Gatsby Source 및 React Component에 적용하는 방법
  2. markdown 문서에 Style 적용하는 방법

첫번째 방법이 CSS적용에 일반적인 방법이다. 지속적으로 페이지에 스타일을 적용할 때는 이 방법을 사용해야 할것이다. 두번째 방법은 한정된 포스팅에서만 일시적으로 사용하는 경우이다. 필자의 경우 이번 포스팅에 한정된 예제를 보여주기 위해서 두번째 방법을 사용하였다.

Markdown에서 html/css를 적용하는 방법은 여러가지가 있으나, Gatsby Plugin인 remark에서는 일반 테그를 사용하듯이 사용하면 된다. 단, 주의 사항은 style 태그는 한번만 사용이 가능한다. 여러곳에서 style 태그를 사용하면 동작하지 않는다.

1. 배경 이미지를 꾸며 보자.

이번 포스팅에서 진행할 내용은, 이제까지 만들어본 Gatsby Blog의 이미지에 여러 가지 부가적인 효과를 부여하는 것이다. 특히, 필자의 윗 타이틀 이미지에 적용되어 있는 "스크롤에 따라 흐르는 배경이미지" (Parallax Background)를 적용해 보자.

다음은 일반 배경이미지와 Parallax 배경이미지를 비교한 결과이다. 좌측 이미지는 Parallax를 적용하였고, 오른쪽 이미지는 일반 배경이미지를 사용하였다. 스크롤을 움직일때 이미지는 스크롤을 따라서 움직이지 않고 보여지는 이미지 윈도우가 이동하는 것처럼 보인다.

Parallax Non Parallax

Parallax : 배경 이미지 자체는 고정되어 있고, 스크롤에 따라서 보여지는 프레임 윈도우가 이동하는 모양이다.

이러한 효과는 다음과 같은 CSSf를 적용하여 구현이 가능하다. 중요한 요소는, background-image와 background-attachment 항목이다. background-attachment 항목을 fixed 로 지정함으로써, 스크롤과 무관하게 이미지를 고정한 결과이다. 나머지는 사이즈와 보여지는 이미지의 크기/반복등에 관한 내용이다.

*아래 예제에서는 고정된 이미지 보다는 unsplash의 random 이미지 url을 사용하였다. 

<style>
.parallax {
  background-image: url("https://source.unsplash.com/random");
  min-height: 500px; 
  width: 500px;
  height: 500px;
  background-attachment: fixed;
  background-position: center;
  background-repeat: no-repeat;
  background-size: cover;
}
</style>

참조 : https://www.w3schools.com/

2 Animation Menu를 만들어 보자

다음과 같은 페이지에 스크롤과 무관한 사이드메뉴 (Fixed)를 만들수 있다. 아래 이미지는 그 결과물이다. 또한 현재 포스팅에 한정하여 이 메뉴를 적용해 두었다.

Animation Menu 아이템 선택 1 Animation Menu 아이템 선택 2
About Blog Projects Contact

사용되는 CSS와 HTML은 다음과 같다. 

#Sidenav a {
  position: fixed;
  left: -90px;
  transition: 0.3s;
  padding: 15px;
  width: 100px;
  text-decoration: none;
  font-size: 20px;
  color: white;
  border-radius: 0 5px 5px 0;
}
#Sidenav a:hover {
  left: 0;
}
#about {
  top: 20px;
  background-color: #04AA6D;
}
#blog {
  top: 80px;
  background-color: #2196F3;
}
#projects {
  top: 140px;
  background-color: #f44336;
}
#contact {
  top: 200px;
  background-color: #555
}

위 CSS에서 position 속성값에 따라서 메뉴가 출력되는 위치가 달라진다. 페이지의 가장 위쪽에 메뉴가 표현되기를 원할 경우는 absolute를 추천한다. 필자는 스크롤을 내려도 메뉴가 위치를 유지하고 따라오는 것을 원했기 때문에 fixed를 적용하였다. 

<div id="Sidenav" >
	<a href="#" id="about">About</a>
	<a href="#" id="blog">Blog</a>
	<a href="#" id="projects">Projects</a>
	<a href="#" id="contact">Contact</a>
</div>

item.title: Add an icon(Favicon) to your own blog/website.
item.description: Add an icon to your own blog/website. If you started creating your own blog and website without using blog platforms such as Naver or Tisto…
item.content:encoded:
Add an icon to your own blog/website.

If you started creating your own blog and website without using blog platforms such as Naver or Tistory, you will start to feel the lack of it. We recognize that we have been enjoying the various services provided by the blogging platform, knowingly and without knowing it. Things that you initially thought were insignificant start to bother your eyes.

The first thing that catches your eye is the icon. Even if it's not pretty, I don't think it's a rare icon that looks like that inactive.

Making it pretty should be done little by little when the time comes, let's start with an assortment.

What is a Favicon?

A favicon is an icon image representing a website, and you can think of it as an icon image displayed on a tab when a web browser is opened.

These are the images below.

It can be used by declaring the <head>following on the website link.

<link rel="shortcut icon" href="http://mysite.com/myicon.ico"/>

Alternatively, a relative address is possible as follows.

<link rel="shortcut icon" href="/myicon.ico"/>

Icon preparation

Now that you know what a favicon is and how to use it, it's time to prepare the actual material (icon). If you already have an icon or have an icon made with Photoshop, you can skip to the next section.

If you are a user who is weak in design like me, I recommend using the following website to make a rough icon. (If you have an image editing tool such as Photoshop or Illustrator, you can just use it.)

web image editor

In the past, I used Photoshop a lot. I used it easily because I had a school/institutional license, but these days there are no institutional licenses and it seems that 10 years have passed since I used Photoshop. Still, the Photoshop style I used in the past is comfortable for me as I am familiar with image editing.

There is a web image editor that is made very similar to the UI of Photoshop, and I will introduce it. Because it works on the website, it doesn't require any special installation, and it is easy to use compared to other web image editors because it manages layered well.

  • Pixlr Editor : https://pixlr.com/kr/

When accessing the website, there are two types of PIXLR editors. 1) Photo Editor like Photoshop, 2) Design editor driven by template base to create images. Each has its own characteristics and is helpful.

In this post, you need Photo Editor. The Design Editor recommends that you try each of them once.
PIXLR E : https://pixlr.com/kr/e/#editor PIXLR X : https://pixlr.com/kr/x

Since the image editor is very similar to Photoshop, many users will be familiar with it. In my case, I roughly filled the background color with a gradient, drew a few shapes, and gave it a round. And save.. it took about 5 minutes.

The image on the right is the template designer (PIXLR X) screen. Because it provides different types of templates, you can create something very quickly and simply. The downside is that there are a lot of paid features, so usage is limited. Because a trial version is provided, you can use it for a while and decide whether to continue using it at that time, so you can try the free function first... Cool!

The following templates are provided. I think I can do something quickly.

  • Other Design Editor (Mango Board)

    Although their uses are different, they refer to Mango Board, a domestic service, when making designs/posters on the web.

    • Mango Board: https://www.mangoboard.net/

Ready to icon

Anyway, let's start with the assortment. I secured the icon in about 5 minutes as shown below. (It's an icon that doesn't really mean much. I just drew it roughly to erase the gray icon.)

Save the image as an image file such as PNG or JPG. You can use the icon as a PNG itself, but let's make it an ICO file for versatility.

Convert to Icon File

It must be converted into an icon file that is different from images such as PNG. The size of the icon is 16x16, or 32x32. If favicon 생성you search on Google, many sites will appear, so you can select one of them and upload the file to convert it. Here we give an example of one of them.

Recommended ICON creation site

  • https://www.favicon-generator.org/ : Favicon only
  • https://icoconvert.com/ : Create various icons as well as Favicon

Below is a screen shot of each site. Just upload the prepared icon file (PNG, JPG) and convert it into an ICO file.

Favicon Generator Icon Converter

In this article, I will post by following the favicon generator. Optimized for PyCon, it also provides a guide on creating various icons and applying tags. (Actually, it is the same no matter which site you use.) The following are the files downloaded from the site after conversion.

Applying a Favicon

character. Now, if you add the following content inside the tag of your website, the application of the favicon is completed.

<link rel="shortcut icon" href="favicon.ico">
<link rel="icon" href="favicon.ico">

shortcut iconThe icon reason for inserting the and two is because the keywords referenced by each browser are different.

<link rel="icon" type="image/png" href="favicon.ico" sizes="16x16" />

In some cases, the size is specified as in the code above.

Gatsby

In the case of a general website/blog, favicon.icoyou can /publicput the file in . However, when using Gatsby, this environment may be changed by themes or plugins. Therefore, in the case of Gatsby, it is necessary to additionally proceed with the following actions.

/static``favicon.icoCopying files to a folder

By default, Gatsby ./publicrecreates the folder every time it builds. Therefore, even if /publicyou copy it directly to the folder, it will be deleted anyway. /staticJust copy it to the folder you use for this purpose .

/src/images change ico to folder

/src/imagesIf you go to , icon.pngthere will be a file. Replace this file with the png file used when creating the favicon. When gatsby builds, this file automatically creates icons of various sizes.

Add html link tag

Most of Gatsby's themes will already <Helmet/>manage these parts through components. <Helme>Go to the file where the component is defined and add the following.

<Helmet>
        <link rel="shortcut icon" href="favicon.ico" />
        <link rel="icon" href="favicon.ico" />
        <link rel="icon" type="image/png" href="favicon.ico" sizes="16x16" />
        .... 기타 다른 메타테그 ....
      </Helmet>

When testing in the browser, the icon file that the browser has already cached in the past is used. Therefore, if the screen does not change even after changing the icon, clear the cache and try again.

item.title: Add to Comment System at your blog (ft.Disqus)
item.description: Let's comment on the Gatsby blog. So far, I have built my own blog with Gatsby. Download Gatsby, customize it, build it, and upload it to G…
item.content:encoded:
Let's comment on the Gatsby blog.

So far, I have built my own blog with Gatsby. Download Gatsby, customize it, build it, and upload it to Github to make your own blog with Git Page. I also changed the blog icon.

But, let's think again . Gatsby is a static website generator (JAM Stack). This means that you simply create static HTML and load it from a storage such as network storage and display it in a web browser. It means that it cannot receive user information such as receiving information and storing it in a database like a general website.

Simply put, you cannot receive feedback such as comments and likes from your neighbors .

Recently, as more and more places use correction sites, a comment adding function that receives visitor feedback such as comments is being operated as a separate service. Examples include Disqus and livere. Recently, it is known that Naver provides similar services as plug-ins, but it is excluded from the subject because of its low versatility.

Anyway, Gatsby provides a separate plug-in for Disqus, and it is the most familiar among similar services, so Disqus is safe. Below is the final output we aim for in this article. The goal is to add Disus comments to your static website blog.

  • Setting up Disqus

    The following is the official Disqus website. Go to the official website GET STARTEDand click to start.

    • Official website: https://disqus.com/
    • Official blog: https://blog.disqus.com/
Disqus 공식 웹사이트 처음에는 사이트 생성부터 진행한다.

Since social logins such as Google and FACEBOOK are possible, the sign-up process is omitted.

If you press GET STARTED , two menus appear. I was a little confused at first here. The first menu seemed to be the case, but the second menu says that it is installed. What do you mean? do i need to install it? Do I have to install something locally or on a web server? It is not, and if we understand it Configure, the corresponding to Installis marked with . Let's not be surprised.

If you select the second menu (install), the website registration screen appears. The most important thing here Website Nameis Since the name indicated here will be used to distinguish Disqus later, shortnamethis value must be a unique value, and is a value that is also referred to the setting value applied to the website later. The rest of the information is roughly what you enter.

For reference, the first menu is the menu that (existing user) checks and responds to comments when it is already set. The first signup/accessor must go to the second menu and set up Disqus first.

Get Started Comment on Sites (첫번째 메뉴)

Disqus Setup (Install ?)

Disqus configuration requires the following steps. Although it is difficult to explain, in fact, you only need to set up a rate plan and proceed with the second step.

  • Select Plan
  • Install Disqus
  • Configure Disqus
  • Setup Moderation

Stage 1. Select Plan.

First of all, you can use it for free. It's laid out at the very bottom. More advanced users can choose to use according to the pricing policy.

Step 2. Install Disqus

Step 2 is further divided into two steps. 1) platform selection, 2) actual website setup.

There are several supported platforms, but in fact, there is not much that changes for this platform. There are different ways to use/configure Disqus depending on the platform, only the guide is different. In fact, if you are familiar with the blog or CMS you are using, you may already know how to set it up. Anyway, we currently blog with Gatsby, but let's choose Gatsby.

If you select Gatsby, it will now display a page explaining how to apply Disqus to Gatsby. Installation proceeds as follows based on Gatsby.

  1. Gatsby-plugin-disqus install
npm install --save gatsby-plugin-disqus
  1. Set the plugin in Gatsby-config.js. (It is the same as the process of installing other plug-ins in Gatsby.) short nameEnter the input you entered during the initial website registration process here . This process is one of the most important.
// gatsby-config.js
module.exports = {
    plugins: [
        {
            resolve: `gatsby-plugin-disqus`,
            options: {
                shortname: `your short name`
            }
        },
    ]
}
  1. Applying a real web page

Applied to actual web pages. Since Gatsby is based on ReactJS, you can import and use Disqus React Component. The official guide below says Templateto create a new , but <Disqus/> you only need to add/insert a component to the existing template . The most important thing here is to separate the pages identifier.

import { Disqus } from 'gatsby-plugin-disqus';

const Template = () => (
    /* Page contents */

    <Disqus
        config={
            /* Replace PAGE_URL with your post's canonical URL variable */
            url: 'PAGE_URL',
            /* Replace PAGE_IDENTIFIER with your page's unique identifier variable */
            identifier: 'PAGE_IDENTIFIER',
            /* Replace PAGE_TITLE with the title of the page */
            title: 'PAGE_TITLE',
        }
    />
);

For me, identifierthe slugwas put value. If it slugis not an eigenvalue anyway, an error occurs. Also, since the file creation unit is also slug, if you use Gatsby, you can input the slug value as the id.

Recently, many themes have installed Disqus by default. Therefore, in some config.jsThemes, if Disqus shortname is written in the file, Disqus will run automatically.

item.title: Add to Data Analytics (ft. GoogleAnalytics)
item.description: Your own blog. Everything is good. But. With twists and turns, we created our own blog. It is not simply using a blog platform, but a websi…
item.content:encoded:
Your own blog. Everything is good. But.

With twists and turns, we created our own blog. It is not simply using a blog platform, but a website that you can modify to suit your own taste. Files and themes can also be adjusted at will. In terms of convenience, it is of course convenient to use a blog platform, but there is something to learn while building such a system, and it helps to improve competency. After all, it's easy to transition to React.

There are these advantages, but there are no small things. must be filled

This is what I felt the need for in this post.

When given for granted, this was forgotten by its very existence. Visitor Analytics

Visitor analysis function is required.

It is simply Which posts are mainly read by visitorsa question of visitor trends . Isn't the fact that people don't read it beyond curiosity is a problem in itself and something that needs to be fixed? However, as already mentioned, static websites such as Gatsby do not have a database, so these data cannot be managed.

Of course, you can see it roughly on the Git Page, but as you can see, it lacks a lot. The relationship between the visitor and the code commit is not well differentiated, and it is impossible to analyze which page has been accessed.

In the case of Netlify, there is an analytics function, but it costs $9 per month.

Github Traffic Netlify Analytics ($9/month)

The graph above is monitoring for traffic analysis provided by Github. Although it is possible to distinguish between visitors and owners, there are many areas lacking in visitor analysis. That's why I desperately needed Google Analytics, which I didn't really care about until then. Also, I feel the need to do it. That's why they seem to have searched for Google Analytics.. (Although, of course, analysis has a big direct impact on marketing.)

Google Analytics (GA: Google Analytics)

For this reason, I tried adding Google Analytics (GA) to a static website created with Gatsby. When someone visits our website, a script in Google Analytics is executed, and various additional analysis such as visitor trends, access pages, access routes, access keywords, and access regions and age groups in Google services will be possible in some cases.

I am not a professional marketing person, so my purpose is to secure only access trends, access pages, and keywords.

The following is the main page that you can see when you access Google Analytics. I don't know where on earth to register additional websites for analysis. After looking at it for a while, I found the Settings icon (Management) at the bottom left corner . (Usually, I think that registration on a new site should be at the beginning, right?)

If you have a Google account, Analytics is immediately available. Skip the Google account sign-up process.

Click the "Manage" button to open the Create Property - Property Setting page. In the property name, enter a delimiting string to distinguish the newly added website. In addition, there are items such as time zone setting (since customer analysis, etc. may vary depending on the time), and you can enter it according to your region and target group. Next, the category of the object to be analyzed is selected. There are categories of Web/Android App/Blog. In this post, we have chosen a blog.

속성 만들기 데이터 수집 설정

Next is data stream setting. The term data stream may be unfamiliar, but from the data point of view, it seems appropriate to think of it as a data source. Here, enter the URL address value of the target site/blog and give it a name. Then choose Create Stream.

I entered the URL of the blog, and the stream name was My Tech Blog. After creating the stream, there is a guide for tags at the bottom. Click "Add new on-page tag" to see the tagging guide.

The following is Google's official script provided when "Add new on-page tag" is clicked.

Existing on-page tag usage is outdated. Codes with GA ID of "UA-xxxx" use existing tags. I used the newly applied tag.

Now, you only need <head> to insert the tags provided above so that they can be applied to all pages of your website/blog .

Setting up Google Analytics

We've been talking about static websites using Gatsby so far. Therefore, you can apply the GA application script to Gatsby Layout or Helmet.

However, if you directly enter that script into React or Gatsby's JSX, you will see the following error:

Because JSX looks like pure HTML, but it is not, WEBPACK generates an error while generating JSX as html.

In React, there InnerHTMLis a separate function to input for pure Html input like this. I am using a separate component for GA insertion as shown below. (The following is the Typescript used to create the component.)

import * as React from 'react';


export interface GaProps {
  ga_id: string;
}
const Ga = (props: GaProps) => {
  const { ga_id } = props;
  const htmlContent =`
  <script async src="https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtag/js?id=${ga_id}"></script>
  <script>
    window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];
    function gtag(){dataLayer.push(arguments);}
    gtag('js', new Date());

    gtag('config', '${ga_id}');
  </script>
  `;

  return (
      <div
      id='GaContainer'
      dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html:htmlContent}}
      />
  );
};

export default Ga;

If Ga component was created, it was applied to the actual file as follows. The point to note is that it is <Helmet>not inside the tag, but is created in the Body part of Html. This Ga Componetis <div>because tags are used when creating .

...
import Ga from '../GA';
...

 return (
    <>
      <Helmet>
        <link rel="shortcut icon" href="favicon.ico" />
        <link rel="icon" href="favicon.ico" />
        <link rel="icon" type="image/png" href="favicon.ico" sizes="16x16" />
        <meta name="google-site-verification" content={config.googleSearchConsole ?? ''} />
      </Helmet>

		  <div id="layout">
			<Ga ga_id={config.googleAnalytics ?? ''} />
        ...
      	...
      </div>

When you see that the number of real-time users increases on the screen of Google Analytics, it is finally confirmed. If you commit and log in immediately after applying GA, the history of your access is counted, so check that the existing 0number 1is changed to .

item.title: Hosting Gatsby on Netlify
item.description: Netlify is well adaptable to Gatsby So far, we have built a static site through Gatsby. It was built to be hosted on Github Page using the …
item.content:encoded:
Netlify is well adaptable to Gatsby

  • So far, we have built a static site through Gatsby. It was built to be hosted on Github Page using the Gastby theme to write a blog. The text written in Markdown is changed to my own design, registered in search engines such as Google, and the icon/favicon of the site is applied. As there is no platform support, for visitor analysis, a means to analyze by applying Google Analytics is also prepared.

    However, Github Pagethere may be cases where you want to host using other systems for various reasons . What we hosted on the Github Page is a combination of Git Repositoryroles and Hostingroles for convenience . To be more specific, I didn't use the Git Repository feature. This is because we processed the CI/CD and Git functions that Github is responsible for on the local PC, and /publiclimited the resulting directory to commit/push to Git Pages.

    A more suitable CI/CD model is Git Repositoryto separate the hosting and the hosting functions. The Repository uses the existing Github as it is, but creates a separate Private Repository where the entire Gatsby Source is uploaded. And, Netlifylet's try to link Hosting with Gatsby with the best connection .

    When Commit/Push to Github Repository, CI/CD (Build/Deploy) is executed in Netlify and the static site is hosted in netlify's repository.

    Therefore, it is necessary to proceed as follows.

    • Create a new Github Repository
    • Netlify account setup and GitHub integration
    • Netlify Build, Hosting/DNS Configuration

Create Github Repository

Create a new repository on Github. Give the Gatsby Source an appropriate name as the repository to upload to. Ex) netlifyblog.

There is no need to follow the Github page repository naming convention (userid.github.io). You can create it as a general repository.

I created it as a Private Repository due to concerns about disclosure of sources and API Tokens in Gatsby Source. However, if there is no security problem, it is okay to open it to the public.

Let's upload the currently used Gatsby to the newly created Repository.

git add .
git commit -m "for Netlify Repository"
git branch -M main
git remote add origin https://github.com/sjwind/netlifyblog.git
git push -u origin main

When Commit/Push is completed, you can upload the contents to the Git Repository as follows.

/publicNote that you don't just push directories like Git Pages does .

For files that need to be maintained as Confidential, please manage the .gitignore file well.

Netlify

Netlify : https://www.netlify.com/

Netlify is a dedicated service that performs build (CI) in conjunction with Github, etc., and provides CDN and hosting functions.

Since Netlify is based on linking with Github, account linking (OAuth) is possible if you have a Github account. Alternatively, a Google account can also be linked. Therefore, the registration procedure is omitted. The following is the first screen you will see after signing up for Netlify. No items are displayed because the registered site is still up.

Create a new Netlify site

1. Integration with Git Provider ( GitHub)

New site from GitIf you click the button, a new site is created by fetching the source from the Git Repository. The following is the first step of the Create a new Site screen, and input information about the Git Provider and integration. It can be seen that not only Github but also GitLab and Bitbucket are supported. Since we have been using Github so far, let's press GitHub.

2. Select Repository and Set Permissions

Next, set up your GitHub account and permissions. Authority is always the least authority in principle. Therefore, Gatsby용 repository (Only Select Repositories)select instead of All Repositories . Write permission is unnecessary, so only read permission is granted.

  • 3. Site Setting

    The basic operation of Netlify has GitHub-> CI/CD -> Site save/ Hostinga flow of . Therefore, when executing CI/CD, information and site information should be set. The essential points to note are:

    • Branch to deploy: I used a mainbranch.
    • Build Command: This is a command to build gatsby. gatsby buildornom run build
    • Publish directory: gatsby is in most cases /publicthe static generator's output.

4. Production Deploy

After completing this step and clicking the Next button, the actual source code is downloaded from GitHub, and the Build Command ( gatsby build) specified above is executed to proceed with the build. Then, the result is stored in the Plubic Open directory, the network configuration is completed internally, and the accessible DNS is notified.

The following is the Deploying screen after site setting is completed. Deploy will be completed in about 5 to 10 minutes. In the meantime, come have a cup of coffee. When deployment is complete, you can see that the Production deploysitem has Publishedbeen changed to as shown in the figure below .

Deploy Processing Deploy Complete

Site Deploy is now complete. Additionally, you can add DNS and SSL settings as needed. If custom domain and SSL settings are unnecessary, you can pass them as default values.

5. Domain setting

Next is the Custom Domain setting item. If you click the Next button, it moves to the Custom Domain setting and HTTPS setting menu. If previously skipped or the setting menu does not appear, at Top menu> Settings > Domains at left menuyou can access the setting screen with .

When a site is deployed in Netlify, <identifiers>.netlify.appa domain of the form is basically assigned. If you already have an additional domain, you can register a custom domain under it. When the custom domain is normally registered, the gray shaded Check DNStext disappears.

Custom Domain 설정 메뉴 접속 Custom Domain 설정 화면

Also, in the HTTPS menu, TLS Certi. can be selected. If you use a separate TLS certificate, you can register here. Otherwise Provision certificate, click on the bottom left to use the default Netlify certificate.

Now, you have successfully completed building your Netlify site. Now, connect to the domain assigned to the site and check if the website is operating normally. The following is a screenshot of a site running on my Netlify service.
